alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 1:47PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson and east central Iowa Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 147 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oxford, or 14 miles west of Iowa City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coralville and Tiffin around 205 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include North Liberty, Oakdale, University Heights, Hills and Iowa City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 225 and 246. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
